name: 奈米科技
goals: Understand the concepts and principles of nanotechnology
Establish the capabilities of preparation and synthesis for nanomaterials
Build the capabilities of process and application for nanostructures
Build the capabilities of design and fabrication for nanodevices
Establish the application capabilities of nanomaterials and nanostructures in emerging technology fields
Develop integrated application capabilities of nanotechnology in emerging technology industries
Improve the ability to write special technical reports
syllabus:
18 weeks:

1st week: Course introduction

2nd week: Introduction to Nanotechnology (I)

3nd week: Introduction to Nanotechnology (II)

4rd week: Origin and Properties of Fullerene and Carbon Nanotube

5th week: Synthesis and Preparation Methods of Carbon Nanotube

6th week: Potential Application of Carbon Nanotubes

7rd week: Origin and Properties of Graphene

8th week: Synthesis and Preparation Methods of Graphene Film

9th week: Synthesis and Preparation Methods of Graphene Powder

10th week: Mass Production Technology and Application Potential of Graphene

11th week: Fabrication Technology of Silicon Microstructures

12th week: Fabrication Technology of Silicon Nanostructures

13th week: Silicon Micro/Nano Structure Applied to Emerging Energy Devices

14th week: Preparation Technology of Zinc Oxide Nanowires

15th week: Application Technology of Zinc Oxide Nanowires

16th week: Detection Method in Nano Science and Technology (I)

17th week: Detection Method in Nano Science and Technology (II)

18th week: Final Report

methodologies.note: Explain the concepts and principles of various fabrication or synthesis processes of nanomaterials, components and systems in the nanotechnology fields.
Discuss the application examples of nanotechnology and some supplementary materials on their relevance to modern emerging industries.
Watch and discuss the related nanotechnology videos

Select topics related to nanotechnology, train students to have the ability to search for SCI-level journal papers, read and translate them, and organize them as a technical report that conforms to academic formats.

grading.note: Assess student attendance and participation in class discussions

Read an English SCI journal paper related to nanotechnology and translate it as a Chinese written report in an assigned format, which will train students to have the ability to search SCI-level journals and write technical reports in a specified format.

Oral report: Organize the above-mentioned nanotechnology paper into an assigned PPT format and give an oral report in groups at the end of the term. This will train students to have the ability to make oral technical reports on stage.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
